metadata.title: CVE-2018-14611 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.17.10. There is ause-after-free in try_merge_free_space() when mounting a crafted btrfsimage, because of a lack of chunk type flag checks inbtrfs_check_chunk_valid in fs/btrfs/volumes.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14611` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1106-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1106.114
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1110.115
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1079-aws - 4.4.0-1079.89
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-azure - 4.15.0-1055.60
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1040-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1043-kvm - 4.4.0-1043.49
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-145.171').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1106.114').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.115').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1079.89').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.60').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1043.49').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1017.22~recert1').
